title: Starling's Anne Boden hits out at 'unfair' practices of big banks
text:
Starling boss Anne Boden has railed against the "unfair" practices of the traditional banks which she said needed to be "driven out" of the industry.

Speaking at The Telegraph's Tech4Good event today, Ms Boden said it was "unfair to charge people penalty interest rates when they go overdrawn accidentally, and it's unfair to actually quote overdraft prices in a way that sounds cheap but are very expensive".

"Starling has created a movement of people and a movement of companies that are changing the industry, and the rest of the incumbents are reacting by making banking fairer for everyone," she added.

Ms Boden is seen as a veteran of the banking industry, having previously held senior positions...
description: Starling boss Anne Boden has railed against the "unfair" practices of the traditional banks which she said needed to be "driven out" of the industry.
